summary.seg: This composite manuscript consists of two separate parts that were written towards the end of the 14th-century in England (ff. 4r-63v and ff. 64r-92v). It features theological works by Bernard of Clairvaux, Honorius of Autun and a previously unidentified compilation of extracts from Bonaventure's Breviloquium. The manuscript also features several Middle English cosmetic and medical recipes that were added in the late 15th or early 16th century (ff. 2r, 83v, 92v-93v).

Dr Clarck Drieshen
Project Cataloguer
Cambridge University Library

foliation.note: Numbering in pencil in the upper right-hand corner of the rectos.
ff. [i]-[iv] and [v]-[viii] are early modern paper leaves of which ff. [i], [ii], [vii] and [viii] are stubs.

additions.note: Table of contents for the manuscript as a whole (f. 1v), written in Latin in a 17th-century hand, listing only Bernard of Clairvaux, Liber de gratia et libero arbitrio; Honorius of Autun, Imago Mundi; and the anonymous theological treatise identified by its first section: De sapientia dei; perhaps added when it was acquired by Cambridge University Library as part of the library of Richard Holdsworth (1590-1649), Master of Emmanuel College: the table of contents matches exactly with the manuscript's description in in the inventory of Holdsworth's manuscripts compiled by William Crowe (Cambridge, University Library, MS Dd.8.45, f. 153v [p. 301]).

binding.p: Early 18th-century 'Cambridge' binding of stained brown calfskin with two blind-tooled panels consisting of a large rectangular frame of 2 lines around the cover's edges with a smaller rectangular frame with blind-stamped flower motifs in its corners at the centre.
The spine has a gold-stamped title label of red russia leather in a gold-tooled frame.
Paper pastedowns on the inside covers are leaves from an early modern printed book, containing a Latin poem with reference to Classical works, including Virgil's Aeneid.

provenance.p: One of the manuscripts of Richard Holdsworth (1590-1649), Master of Emmanuel College Holdsworth, Richard, 1590-1649.

history.acquisition: Acquired by the University Library in July 1664: no. 174 (this number also inscribed on f. 1r) in the inventory of Holdsworth's manuscripts compiled by William Crowe (Cambridge, University Library, MS Ff.4.27 / Dd.8.45).

recordHist.source: This catalogue entry draws on Margaret Connolly, Manuscripts in the University Library, Cambridge (Dd-Oo) , The Index of Middle English Prose, 17 (Cambridge: Brewer, 2009); and an unpublished description of the manuscript composed between 1926 and 1930 by M.R. James James, M.R. (Montague Rhodes), 1862-1936, now held in the University Archives (UA ULIB 7/3/74).

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card. For information on eligibility and admissions procedures, see Joining the Library). For further information on the availability of the manuscript, please contact the Manuscripts Reading Room.

custodialHist.custEvent: Recorded as no. 494 in an inventory of Cambridge University Library's manuscripts compiled c. 1672 (now Cambridge, University Library, MS Oo.7.59).

monogr.title: Archives d'histoire doctrinale et littéraire du Moyen Âge
Manuscripts in the University Library, Cambridge (Dd-Oo)

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, University Library, MS Ff.6.51, ff. 1r-63v

msItem.title: Collection of cosmetic recipes
msItem.textLang: Middle English recipes with Latin headings
msItem.incipit: 2r Ad de albandam faciem: Take freshe bores grece
msItem.explicit: 2r makyth hym fayre y colowryd certisime
msItem.note: Added in the late 15th or early 16th century.

msItem.author: Bernard of Clairvaux
msItem.title: Liber de gratia et libero arbitrio
msItem.rubric: 4r Bernardus de gratia et libero arbitrio
msItem.incipit: 4r Domino Willelmo abbati sancti theodoric frater bernardus
msItem.explicit: 32r Denique quos iustificavit non quos iustos in venit: hos et magnificavit

msItem.author: Bernard of Clairvaux
msItem.title: Liber de praecepto et dispensatione
msItem.incipit: 32r Dono abbati columbensi frater B. abbas dictus de clara valle
msItem.explicit: 62v Vestre Debui quod et studui Satisffacere Voluntati

msItem.title: Untitled theological tract
msItem.explicit: 63v quod experti egipcii de uoti sunt

catchwords.seg: Horizontal catchwords, but mostly cropped off.

supportDesc.condition: The outer margins of ff. 11-63 have been stained, possibly due to water damage, and in many cases torn, but without loss of text; there are sewing marks around a tear in the outer lower margin of f.41.

layout.seg: Ruled in leadpoint, frame, with occasional line ruling. Single columns. 25 lines to the page, written below top line.

handNote.p: This part of the manuscript is written by a single scribe in Northern Gothica Textualis.
Added cosmetic recipes on f. 2r are written in Secretary, but with occasional Anglicana round 'e'.

decoNote.p: Partial (one-sided) border of blue and red penwork on f. 4r.
Two- or three-line blue initials with red penwork decoration on ff. 4r, 32r-33r.
One-line capitals highlighted in red throughout.

origin.origDate: Copied in the second half of the 14th century.

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, University Library, MS Ff.6.51, ff. 64r-92v

msContents.textLang: Latin, with added Middle English recipes

msItem.author: Honorius of Autun
msItem.title: Imago Mundi
msItem.incipit: 64r Ad instruxionem multorum quibus deest copia librorum hic libellus edatur
msItem.explicit: 82v hinc longe dicitur supereminere celum celorum in qui habitat rex angelorum per omnia secula seculorum. Amen

msItem.title: Collection of medical recipes
msItem.incipit: 83v For stynkyng breth: Take red mente and rew
msItem.explicit: 83v for þe stomake: Take centaney and rosmary and seþe with wyne
msItem.note: Added in the late 15th or early 16th century.

msItem.author: Bonaventure
msItem.title: Breviloquium pauperis seu compendium sacrae scripturae (Five exctracted chapters)
msItem.rubric: 84r De sapientia dei / De voluntate dei / De integritate eukaristi / De integritate penitentie
msItem.incipit: 83v De sapiencia dei hec sunt tenenda
msItem.explicit: 92v reconsilienti deo et sancte matri ecclesie veraciter penitentes
msItem.note: Anonymous theological treatise in five chapters extracted from Bonaventure, Breviloquium: De sapientia dei [I.8], De voluntate dei [I.9], De creatura mundi, [II.1] (omitted from the rubric heading), De integritate eukaristie [6.IX], and De integritate penitentie [6.X].

msItem.title: Collection of medical recipes
msItem.textLang: Middle English recipes with Latin headings
msItem.incipit: 92v Pro obturacione stomachi: Take egremoyne and stampe hit well
msItem.explicit: 93v Also take j Archangel and seþe hit in water and þat is good for þe same
msItem.note: Added in the late 15th or early 16th century.

msItem.author: Peter Lombard
Pseudo-Augustine
msItem.title: Untitled theological tract on the Four Cardinal Virtues extracted from Peter Lombard, Sententiarum libri IV, Distincio XXXIII, and Pseudo-Augustine De Spiritu et Anima
msItem.explicit: 94r: Prudentia consistit in eligendis. fortitudo in tollerandis: temperancia in utendi. iusticia in distribuendis
msItem.note: Added in the late 15th or early 16th century.

msItem.title: Untitled note about sacerdotal powers
msItem.incipit: 94r Dicitur antem proprius sacerdos quicumque habet potestatem absolvendi ordinariam vel delegatam sive sit communis sive singularis
msItem.note: Full transcription; added in the late 15th or early 16th century.

msItem.author: Gregory IX
Raymond of Peñafort
msItem.title: Decretals of Gregory IX (Extract)
msItem.incipit: 95v: Deus in signum universalis dominii iussit decimas dari
msItem.explicit: 95v: Extracta de decimis capitulo tua nobis
msItem.note: Extract of the Drecetals of Gregory IX, Book III, Chapter XXVI, added in the late 15th or early 16th century.

condition.note: f. 96 features several large cuts, perhaps made with a pen knife.

layout.seg: Ruled in leadpoint, frame only. Single columns. 25 lines to the page, written below top line.

handNote.p: This part of the manuscript is written by a single scribe in Northern Gothica Textualis.
Added medical recipes on ff. 83v, 92v-93v are written in Secretary, but with Anglicana features, including the round 'e' (regular) and long 'r' (occasional).

decoNote.p: Two-line blue or red initials with with penwork decoration in the opposite colour and sometimes with partial (singl) J-borders in blue and red.
One-line initials alternatively in blue and red used in the table of contents on 64r.
One-line capitals highlighted in red throughout.
Line filler in red ink on 84r.
Headings rubricated in red ink throughout.
Marginal chapter numbers in Roman numerals in blue and red.
Paraphs alternatively in blue and red.

origin.origDate: Copied in the second half of the 14th century

change.persName: Clarck Drieshen, Project Cataloguer in Curious Cures in Cambridge Libraries, Cambridge University Library
